page.title: 12TRANSPORT IN RODNEY STOKE
page.content: Most people have access to a car for travel to areas outside the Parish but the bus service is still important for a few, albeit a declining few. Bristol Omnibus operates a service between{Wells}and{Weston-Super-Mare which passes along the A371 through Rodney Stoke. In a normal summer week day there are 16 buses from about 7.45 a.m. to 9.00 p.m. so a reasonably regular service is available but the frequency drops in winter. A major problem for local residents is the volume of through traffic particularly lorries, and many people fear an accident in the near future. Many of the lorries are connected with the local Mendip quarrying industry and are passing to and from Westbury quarry on the edge of the Mendips near the village.
